title: Weekly snapshot of Chinese culture news
content:
BEIJING, Nov. 23 (Xinhua) -- The following are the highlights of China's key culture news from the past week:
-- Disney's "Frozen 2" to hit Chinese theaters
"Frozen 2," a sequel to the 2013 Disney animated blockbuster "Frozen," hit theaters on the Chinese mainland on Friday, leading the box office on the first day of its screening with about 72.52 million yuan (around 10.31 million U.S. dollars).
The animated musical fantasy film continues the story of Elsa, a queen with icy powers, and her warmhearted sister Anna. In the new film, Anna and Elsa travel to an ancient enchanted forest to find the origin of Elsa's powers in order to save their kingdom.
-- Documentaries highlighted at national film festival
The 28th China Golden Rooster and Hundred Flowers Film Festival launched special screenings of five Chinese documentaries Wednesday, the first time the film festival has held a promotion for documentaries since its founding in 1992.
The increasing need for cultural products in China has strongly pushed forward the development of documentaries, particularly quality products that maintain a good balance between social responsibility and commercial feasibility, experts said.
-- 2019 Chinese Character and Word of the Year to be selected
An annual campaign has been kicked off to select the 2019 Chinese Character and Word of the Year from applications submitted by the public.
The one-month event will select Chinese words and phrases which are newly created or widely used online based on experts' opinions and big data to highlight the changes of China and the world this year, according to the organizers, the Chinese National Language Monitoring and Research Center and the Commercial Press.
